items.title: Beetlejuice
items.actors: Alec Baldwin, Geena Davis, Annie McEnroe, Maurice Page
items.plot: A couple of recently deceased ghosts contract the services of a "bio-exorcist" in order to remove the obnoxious new owners of their house.

items.title: The Cotton Club
items.actors: Richard Gere, Gregory Hines, Diane Lane, Lonette McKee
items.plot: The Cotton Club was a famous night club in Harlem. The story follows the people that visited the club, those that ran it, and is peppered with the Jazz music that made it so famous.

items.title: The Shawshank Redemption
items.actors: Tim Robbins, Morgan Freeman, Bob Gunton, William Sadler
items.plot: Two imprisoned men bond over a number of years, finding solace and eventual redemption through acts of common decency.

items.title: Crocodile Dundee
items.actors: Paul Hogan, Linda Kozlowski, John Meillon, David Gulpilil
items.plot: An American reporter goes to the Australian outback to meet an eccentric crocodile poacher and invites him to New York City.

items.title: Valkyrie
items.actors: Tom Cruise, Kenneth Branagh, Bill Nighy, Tom Wilkinson
items.plot: A dramatization of the 20 July assassination and political coup plot by desperate renegade German Army officers against Hitler during World War II.

items.title: Ratatouille
items.actors: Patton Oswalt, Ian Holm, Lou Romano, Brian Dennehy
items.plot: A rat who can cook makes an unusual alliance with a young kitchen worker at a famous restaurant.

items.title: City of God
items.actors: Alexandre Rodrigues, Leandro Firmino, Phellipe Haagensen, Douglas Silva
items.plot: Two boys growing up in a violent neighborhood of Rio de Janeiro take different paths: one becomes a photographer, the other a drug dealer.

items.title: Memento
items.actors: Guy Pearce, Carrie-Anne Moss, Joe Pantoliano, Mark Boone Junior
items.plot: A man juggles searching for his wife's murderer and keeping his short-term memory loss from being an obstacle.

items.title: Ex Machina
items.actors: Domhnall Gleeson, Corey Johnson, Oscar Isaac, Alicia Vikander
items.plot: A young programmer is selected to participate in a ground-breaking experiment in synthetic intelligence by evaluating the human qualities of a breath-taking humanoid A.I.

items.title: Shogun
items.actors: Richard Chamberlain, Toshirô Mifune, Yôko Shimada, Furankî Sakai
items.plot: A English navigator becomes both a player and pawn in the complex political games in feudal Japan.

items.title: Spotlight
items.actors: Mark Ruffalo, Michael Keaton, Rachel McAdams, Liev Schreiber
items.plot: The true story of how the Boston Globe uncovered the massive scandal of child molestation and cover-up within the local Catholic Archdiocese, shaking the entire Catholic Church to its core.

items.title: Vertigo
items.actors: James Stewart, Kim Novak, Barbara Bel Geddes, Tom Helmore
items.plot: A San Francisco detective suffering from acrophobia investigates the strange activities of an old friend's wife, all the while becoming dangerously obsessed with her.

items.title: Whiplash
items.actors: Miles Teller, J.K. Simmons, Paul Reiser, Melissa Benoist
items.plot: A promising young drummer enrolls at a cut-throat music conservatory where his dreams of greatness are mentored by an instructor who will stop at nothing to realize a student's potential.

items.title: Hotel Rwanda
items.actors: Xolani Mali, Don Cheadle, Desmond Dube, Hakeem Kae-Kazim
items.plot: Paul Rusesabagina was a hotel manager who housed over a thousand Tutsi refugees during their struggle against the Hutu militia in Rwanda.

items.title: The Martian
items.actors: Matt Damon, Jessica Chastain, Kristen Wiig, Jeff Daniels
items.plot: An astronaut becomes stranded on Mars after his team assume him dead, and must rely on his ingenuity to find a way to signal to Earth that he is alive.

items.title: To Kill a Mockingbird
items.actors: Gregory Peck, John Megna, Frank Overton, Rosemary Murphy
items.plot: Atticus Finch, a lawyer in the Depression-era South, defends a black man against an undeserved rape charge, and his kids against prejudice.

items.title: The Hateful Eight
items.actors: Samuel L. Jackson, Kurt Russell, Jennifer Jason Leigh, Walton Goggins
items.plot: In the dead of a Wyoming winter, a bounty hunter and his prisoner find shelter in a cabin currently inhabited by a collection of nefarious characters.

items.title: A Separation
items.actors: Peyman Moaadi, Leila Hatami, Sareh Bayat, Shahab Hosseini
items.plot: A married couple are faced with a difficult decision - to improve the life of their child by moving to another country or to stay in Iran and look after a deteriorating parent who has Alzheimer's disease.

items.title: The Big Short
items.actors: Ryan Gosling, Rudy Eisenzopf, Casey Groves, Charlie Talbert
items.plot: Four denizens in the world of high-finance predict the credit and housing bubble collapse of the mid-2000s, and decide to take on the big banks for their greed and lack of foresight.

items.title: The Hobbit: An Unexpected Journey
items.actors: Ian McKellen, Martin Freeman, Richard Armitage, Ken Stott
items.plot: A reluctant hobbit, Bilbo Baggins, sets out to the Lonely Mountain with a spirited group of dwarves to reclaim their mountain home - and the gold within it - from the dragon Smaug.

items.title: The Great Gatsby
items.actors: Lisa Adam, Frank Aldridge, Amitabh Bachchan, Steve Bisley
items.plot: A writer and wall street trader, Nick, finds himself drawn to the past and lifestyle of his millionaire neighbor, Jay Gatsby.
